intro: Sphondylium proteiforme, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by bead-like, orange berries. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sphondylium proteiforme is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
